revised_title: The Rate of Transmission of the Guatemala Earthquake: A Reexamination of the Time of Arrival of the First and Second Phases
tldr: The author reexamines the records of the 1902 Guatemala earthquake to determine the true time of arrival of the first and second phases of wave motion at various stations. The study aims to clarify the nature of the evidence used to draw time-curves and understand the differences in wave motion between the phases.
